alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 2:09AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CHEROKEE COUNTY THROUGH 245 AM CDT... At 209 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mccune to Baxter Springs. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Baxter Springs, Columbus, Galena, Cherokee, Weir, Lowell, Sherman, Scammon, West Mineral, Treece, Roseland, Neutral, Riverton, Lawton, Carona, Skidmore, Hallowell, Sherwin, Stippville and Crestline. This includes Interstate 44 near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
